title: Elsie Inglis - The Woman With the Torch
description: This is a brief biography of the  Scottish physician and suffragist Dr. Elsie Inglis.  Dr. Inglis founded a maternity hospital  for the poor in Edinburgh (then known as the Hospice, but later as the Elsie Inglis Memorial Hospital), and was known for her charity and willingness to waive fees when patients could not afford her care. She was also a key figure in Scotland's Women's Suffrage Movement.  She is best known, however,  for founding the Scottish Women's Hospitals for Foreign Service, which provided staffed teams of female-staffed field hospitals to war zones during World War I. - Summary by Ciufi Galeazzi
